item.title: Achtung Amerikaner: White Women In Rural America
item.description:
Gordon is joined by special guest Vanessa Roper, a resident of Ozarkia in northern Arkansas, to talk about an article in the Atlantic titled "How Rural America Steals Girls' Futures - Death In A Dying Town" - is this really the case? Are White women, in particular, truly better off pursuing careers and "sexual freedom" in urban centers? Are rural places killing these girls and their families, or are people like the author blaming the victims of rampant globalization and anti-White political policy for the slow death of their way of life?

RELEVANT LINKS

  • Article: https://archive.is/6ao3p
  • Billy Roper Interview: https://amerikaner.org/billy-roper/
  • Gordon's Week In Ozarkia: https://amerikaner.org/gordons-week-in-ozarkia/

This episode was released early for our generous subscribers. If you would like this kind of early access, as well as other exclusive content, please visit Amerikaner.org/Donate

item.title: Achtung Amerikaner: The Magnus Minute - Relationships From The Feminine Perspective
item.description:
The Magnus Minute is proud to present Part I of a two-part series on Sex, Dating, and Relationships. Magnus is joined by 3 married couples from within the pro-White movement to discuss the why's and wherefore's of modern Romance. In part one we sit down with Pearl, Kate, and Allyson to get answers to that age-old question: What do Women even want? Our 3 panelists give their take on the dating game, give us the female perspective on men, and give tips to young women looking to find a good man on the edge of the apocalypse.

Join us again for Part II, where we'll catch up with the husbands to get the other half of the story!

This episode was released early to our generous subscribers. If you would like this early access, as well as other exclusive content, please visit Amerikaner.org/donate

Achtung! Amerikaner is proudly hosted on Amerikaner.org and ExodusAmericanus.com

item.title: The Godcast: Popcorn N' Soda: Tokyo Revengers
item.description:
In this episode, SuperLutheran and Myles watch a real gem of an anime, Tokyo Revengers. It's got time travel, crime, mystery, thrills, fights, romance, and some really awkwardly paced sections. It wouldn't be Japanese if it was paced properly, now would it? But, before we shake hands with Naoto and head back twelve years into the past, head out to the konbini and grab yourself some Popcorn N' Soda!

Tokyo Revengers: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tokyo_Revengers

Japanese delinquents: https://timeline.com/yankii-subculture-japan-american-c51808fa2172

https://www.nippon.com/en/japan-topics/c11906/

Those kids grow up: https://zoboko.com/text/8m51vvn3/dreamland-japan-writings-on-modern-manga/32

Secu and Linney of #FreeMrBond join Magnus and Gordon Kahl for a special interview/update to discuss the journey thus far regarding Mr. Bond's unjust and heinous imprisonment, with notes of action that YOU can take yourself to help our brother Bond, and other political prisoners in his situation, and a upcoming project that's been in the works for some time now!

item.title: The Godcast: The Godcast, Episode 276: Christian Freedom
item.description:
In this episode, SuperLutheran and Myles take on a question that lurks at the heart of many disagreements among Christians and how we choose to live our lives while still obeying the Lord: Christian Freedom. We discuss what it is, what it means, and how it plays out in our day-to-day lives. We answer your emails after the break.

Are Jews the chosen people of God? No: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pzHB5Caglgo

item.title: Achtung Amerikaner: Standoff At The Rio Grande
item.description:
Gordon is joined by Magnus (of "The Pressure Suit Podcast") and Rick (of "The Smoke Pit") as well as, finally, Grug, to discuss the recent situation at the Rio Grande - specifically, the dispute about razor wire barricades being placed on the shore of the river by the Texas National Guard. This episode was recorded on January 22nd, 2024, and the situation has already escalated - please be aware some of the topics discussed may be out of date as things change on the ground. We will provide an update if an opportunity presents itself.

This episode was released early to our generous subscribers. If you would like this early access, as well as other exclusive content, please visit Amerikaner.org/Donate

item.title: Pressure Suit Podcast: Pressure Suit Podcast - Character and Narrative
item.description:
Magnus and Seba are back with a bonus Pressure Suit Podcast!

Move over Gamer Word, because today we'll be tackling the "ludo" in ludonarrative and how appearance, writing, presentation, and player customization can change the impact of a video game protagonist. Is character customization a way to enshrine player choice and enhance immersion? Or are set characters the better vehicle to tell compelling stories with deep narratives?


Seal your locking ring, check your gauges, secure your line and cycle that airlock, it's time for the Pressure Suit Podcast!
item.dc:creator: Magnus Williams

Hans recommends the book "The Contrary Farmer" by Gene Logsdon.

item.title: The Godcast: The Godcast, Episode 274: Noah the Alien!?

item.title: Pressure Suit Podcast: John W Campbell's Who Goes There / John Carpenter's The Thing (1982)
item.description:
Gordon and Magnus don their parkas and ready their flamethrowers as they dive into the terrifying isolation and paranoia of John W Campbell's Who Goes There? and the sci-fi/horror cinematic adaptation (or should we say, imitation?) The Thing (1982) by John Carpenter. Primarily known as the colossus of Sci-Fi publishing that brought Speculative Fiction out of the pulp era and mentored some of the great writers of the 20th century, Campbell blends paranoia, isolation, and eldritch terror into a powerful tale of man against...Thing.


Carpenter's 1982 Sci-Fi Horror classic masterfully adapts the story for the silver screen, and combines tight pacing, effortless characterization, and an ensemble cast with Carpenter's signature cinematography, an Ennio Morricone score, and some of the best practical effects of all time.


So grab a bottle of J&B and join us--remember, there are plenty of Imitations, but only ONE Pressure Suit Podcast!
item.dc:creator: Magnus Williams

Gordon, Grug, and Magnus go over three different news stories, giving you their white-hot takes and predictions. From Derek Chauvin having his last hope of justice denied, to a deranged anti-Christian pedophilic transsexual threatening heinous acts, and a small town in Michigan declaring itself a sovereign entity where guns are concerned, there's a little something for everyone.

item.title: The Godcast: Popcorn N' Soda: The Mission (1986)
item.description:

item.title: The Gamer Word on Odysee: The Gamer Word Episode 46- Hobocop: The Coomer, The Zoomer and the Boomer
item.description: The men come together to discuss how Starfield npcs may well be modeled on the (surprisingly and sadly) real life examples that have been shoveled into positions of leadership in once beloved gaming companies (and the political implications of said creatures) with Rolo keeping everyone on the correct page. Bobby admits his shame and guilt in participating in the humiliation ritual that is Spodermin: Nogboy, while Ruckus joins the Japanese in solidarity over the ugly makeover of Princess Peach in the new Mario box art. Bobby redeems himself by sharing all he knows about developments in the AI world and Ruckus shares his initial impressions of the newest game where you get to deal with the problems of Detroit in good old fashioned 80's style of ultra violence and dick shots.

item.description: The men come together to discuss the hyper politicization of gaming to the point that old skins in CoD Source maps are being removed due to recent events before tackling the important questions of the day: Is it AI, or the new form of fedposting? Are Sonic Tots the only good thing to come from Sonic these days (the fanbase is an absolute mess that makes Ruckus seethe with disgust)? Also a quick opening review on The Lords of the Fallen, which Ruckus thinks could/should be an indicator of where the genre of souls-like (though it should be called Bloodborne-like) is headed.

item.title: Achtung Amerikaner: Gordon's Week In Ozarkia
item.description:
Gordon spent a week in the heart of Ozarkia, near Mountain View, Arkansas, a center of traditional folk ways, music, and culture. This episode is a collection of Gordon's thoughts and experiences as he spends an enchanting week in the Natural State, meeting lots of great people and learning a lot about the ways of this quiet part of the American South.

This episode was released early to our generous supporters. If you would like this early access, or other exclusive content, please visit Amerikaner.org/Donate
